intro: Draba hatchiae, commonly known as the Hatch's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in arid and semi-arid regions. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Draba hatchiae has basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers in the spring. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of ecological changes in its habitat.
